intro: Pasania pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved pasania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the winter months. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, adapting well to dry and nutrient-poor conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
